page.title: 11Coastguards
page.content: The Auxilliary Coastguards train once a fortnight during the Summer and once a month during the Winter.First Aid Instruction is given by the St.John's Ambulance.Their uniform is a boiler suit with H.M.S.Coastguard printed on the back.Coastguards have to be over 18yrs and are paid for every practice and call out they attend.Two men walk the beach in sections on the look out for any signs of disaster.If they see beach flares they may operate{the {Breeches Buoy}to get people ashore. They are also trained for cliff rescues using a rocket firing line.The coastguards also search the beach for canisters of dangerous chemicals.The Look-Out is now only manned during storms or adverse weather conditions and during the{Round the Island Yacht {Race}held annually in June.Their last rescue call out was 10yrs ago.
